distributional 0.3.1.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.02066894  9.89921475
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.8915917 0.8762962
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.2110110 -0.1982037
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.4870305  1.0663845  0.2911613 -0.5071391 -0.8141069 -0.1926379
#>  [7]  0.1936779  0.3695782 -0.3328124 -0.2073870
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 11.543745  9.382874 10.279926 10.543247 10.255553 10.705560 10.026950
#>  [8]  8.948861 10.219460  9.897084
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.253374 0.000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.1152255 10.0063091
variance(dist)
#>           [,1]     [,2]
#> [1,] 0.7921373 0.152598
#> [2,] 0.1525980 1.035956
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.01448161
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>               [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -1.063749934  9.352994
#>  [2,]  0.363014809  7.062037
#>  [3,] -1.303037812 10.369218
#>  [4,]  0.826193565 10.038053
#>  [5,] -0.812619662  8.023274
#>  [6,] -0.647543187  8.256216
#>  [7,] -0.252093463  9.524796
#>  [8,]  0.944163393 11.054018
#>  [9,] -0.002481621  9.881008
#> [10,] -0.299897657  8.732977
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2175481 0.0000000
